qas.question: What options do minority party have in amendment phase?

answers.text: offer our program as a substitute

qas.question: If minority party loses committ of the whole, then what motion may be filed?

answers.text: motion to recommit and get a vote on that

qas.question: If recommit fails, then what choice needs to be made by minority representatives?

answers.text: say we did our best to come up with a better alternative. Or they could vote for it and make the same argument

qas.question: How many amendments are usually passed in the committee of the Whole per year?
How many amendments usually come up for a vote each year?
What committee was created by Johnson?
What did Johnson usually lay out in a general debate for the Republicans?

plausible_answers.text: motion to recommit and get a vote on that

qas.question: When the President loses in Committee of the Whole, then what can he file?

context: "We used a technique of laying <b6_0>our program<b6_0/> out in general debate," he said. When we got to the amendment phase, we would <a0_0>offer our program as a substitute<a0_0/> for the Johnson proposal. If we lost in the <b5_0>Committee of the Whole<b5_0/>, then we would usually offer it as a <a1_0><b7_0>motion to recommit and get a vote on that<b7_0/><a1_0/>. And if we lost on the motion to recommit, our Republican members had a choice: They could vote against the Johnson program and <a2_0>say we did our best to come up with a better alternative. Or they could vote for it and make the same argument<a2_0/>. Usually we lost; but when you're only <b3_0>140<b3_0/> out of <b4_0>435<b4_0/>, you don't expect to win many.
